verses.text: 信徒像活石被建造成靈宮所以要除去一切惡毒、一切詭詐、虛偽、嫉妒和一切毀謗的話，

words.note: Lit. 'belief-follower'

verses.text: 像初生嬰孩愛慕那純淨的靈奶，好叫你們靠它長大，進入救恩；
因為你們已經體驗過主是美善的。

words.note: A title for God or Christ.

verses.text: 主是活石，雖然被人棄絕，卻是　神所揀選所珍貴的；你們到他面前來，

words.note: A title for God or Christ.
The leading space in original text is a reverence marker.

verses.text: 也就像活石，被建造成為靈宮，作聖潔的祭司，藉著耶穌基督獻上蒙　神悅納的靈祭。

words.note: Often used in passive constructions, 'to be granted' by a higher power.
The leading space in original text is a reverence marker.

verses.text: 因為經上記著：「看哪，我在錫安放了一塊石頭，就是所揀選所珍貴的房角石，信靠他的人，必不致失望。」

words.note: Refers to 'what is written in the scriptures'.
Lit. 'recorded'.
An exclamation drawing attention.
A nominalizer for a verb or verb phrase, indicating a passive or resultative meaning.
A nominalizer for a verb or verb phrase, indicating a passive or resultative meaning.
The foundational stone at the corner of a building.
A formal way to say 'will not result in'.

verses.text: 所以這石頭，對你們信的人是寶貴的，但對那不信的人，卻是「建築工人所棄的石頭，成了房角的主要石頭。」

words.note: A nominalizer for a verb or verb phrase, indicating a passive or resultative meaning.

verses.text: 它又「作了絆腳的石頭，使人跌倒的磐石。」他們跌倒是因為不順從這道，他們這樣是必然的。

words.note: Lit. 'to trip the foot'.
Refers to a large, immovable rock; often symbolic in scripture.
Refers to God's word or the Christian way.

verses.text: 然而你們是蒙揀選的族類，是君尊的祭司，是聖潔的國民，是屬　神的子民，為要叫你們宣揚那召你們出黑暗入奇妙光明者的美德。

words.note: Often used in formal or religious contexts for receiving grace or blessings.
The leading square character is a traditional reverence marker for God's name.
Here functions like a preposition 'out of'.
Here functions like a preposition 'into'.
Suffix indicating a person or thing with a certain quality or action.

verses.text: 「你們從前不是子民，現在卻是　神的子民；從前未蒙憐恤，現在卻蒙了憐恤。」

words.note: The leading square character is a traditional reverence marker for God's name.
Often used in formal or religious contexts for receiving grace or blessings.
Received (grace/mercy).

verses.text: 應當品行端正親愛的，我勸你們作客旅和寄居的人，要禁戒肉體的私慾，這私慾是與靈魂爭戰的。

words.note: Refers to temporary residents, often used metaphorically for believers on earth.
Similar to 客旅, emphasizes temporary dwelling.
Often used in the Bible to refer to human nature or carnal desires.

verses.text: 你們在教外人中，應當品行端正，使那些人，雖然毀謗你們是作惡的，但因為看見你們的好行為，就要在鑒察的日子頌讚　神。

words.note: Lit. 'people outside the teaching'.
Refers to a specific time, like 'day of judgment' or 'day of visitation'.

verses.text: 你們為主的緣故，要順服人的一切制度，無論是至尊的君王，
或是君王所派賞善罰惡的官員；

words.note: Indicates the preceding noun is the agent of the following verb.
A four-character idiom (chengyu).

verses.text: 因為這是　神的旨意，要藉著你們的善行，塞住糊塗無知人的口。

words.note: Here, 'mouth' refers to what people say or their criticisms.

verses.text: 你們是自由的人，但不要用自由來掩飾邪惡，總要像　神的僕人。

words.note: Plural form of 'you'.

words.definition: must always, always be sure to

words.note: The preceding space is an honorific marker.

verses.text: 要尊重眾人，愛護弟兄，敬畏　神，尊敬君王。

words.definition: to revere, to fear and respect

words.note: The preceding space is an honorific marker.

verses.text: 基督受苦的榜樣你們作僕人的，要凡事敬畏順服主人，不單是對善良溫和的，就是乖僻的也要順服。

words.note: Here, 'those who are servants'.

words.definition: to revere, to fear and respect

words.note: 乖 can mean 'obedient' but here forms 'perverse'.

verses.text: 因為人若在　神面前為良心的緣故，忍受冤屈的苦楚，是有福的。

words.note: The preceding space is an honorific marker.

verses.text: 你們若因犯罪受責打而能忍耐，有甚麼可誇的呢？但你們若因行善而受苦，能忍耐，在　神看來，這是有福的。

words.definition: to sin, to commit a crime
to be punished, to be beaten
to do good, to practice kindness

words.note: The preceding space is an honorific marker.

verses.text: 你們就是為此蒙召，因基督也為你們受過苦，給你們留下榜樣，叫你們跟隨他的腳蹤行。

words.note: Refers to a divine calling.
Often used metaphorically for following someone's example.

verses.text: 「他從來沒有犯過罪，口裡也找不到詭詐。」

words.definition: did not have, there was no

words.note: Refers to inner deceit or trickery.

verses.text: 他被罵的時候不還嘴，受苦的時候也不說恐嚇的話；只把自己交託給那公義的審判者。

words.note: Implies a trustful surrender.
Often refers to God's righteousness.
Referring to God as the ultimate judge.

verses.text: 他在木頭上親身擔當了我們的罪，使我們既然不活在罪中，就可以為義而活。因他受的鞭傷，你們就得了醫治。

words.note: In this context, refers to the cross.
Here, refers to bearing sin (atonement).
Referring to living in a state of sin.
Connects verb phrases, indicating result or purpose.
Wounds resulting from flogging.
Can refer to physical or spiritual healing.

verses.text: 你們從前好像迷路的羊，但現在已經回到你們靈魂的牧人和監督那裡了。

words.note: Often used metaphorically for people in a spiritual sense.
Figurative for a spiritual leader or God.
An ecclesiastical office in the church.
